data.text: @arunvrtvm Hi, please contact our customer service via chatbot on our website or by calling us, you can find the phone numbers here: https://t.co/cDvIoqpvIy. I apologise in advance that waiting times might be long at the moment, as we are getting lots of contacts. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

@Floris51582268 @FinnairHelps @FinnairCargo Hi, I am extremely sorry for the congestion in our customer service channels at the moment! We are getting a very large amount of contacts due to the current situation. Please try one more time contacting our customer service via the chatbot or phone. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

@gottosayit @FinnairHelps Hi, I apologise for the long waiting times in our customer service channels at the moment. Due to the current situation, we are getting a very large amount of contacts in our customer service channels. Thank you for you patience! Kind regards, Ada/Finnair
@Metsanauris Hopefully you had a very nice time above the clouds with us! Welcome on board soon again! Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

With our flexible booking policy, you can book flights and make your travel plans more worry-free and flexibly. Until 31 May 2022, you can change your travel dates as many times as you wish. After that, you can still make one additional change. https://t.co/NQN3hfqxdl

urls.title: Change your booking flexibly
urls.description: With our updated ticket policy, you can now change your travel dates with more flexibility. Book Finnair flights and travel with confidence!

data.text: @Nick92638816 Hello! And apologies for the delay with our answer. Kindly send us direct message with your booking reference, email address and phone number so we can take a look at this. Kind regards, Hanna-Mari

@asallime Hello Asal. I´m sorry to hear about the delay with processing your feedback. Kindly send us direct message with your case number and email address in your case, so we can take a look at the situation. Kind regards, Hanna-Mari

@arosalex Hello! Possibility to take pet in cabin depends on availability on your flight. Kindly send us direct message with more information so we can take a look on availability on your flights. Kind regards, Hanna-Mari
@act_261 Hi! Could you send us a private message (DM) with booking code and phone number + email. We do not handle bookings via tweets due security and passenger privacy details. -Anu / Finnair

data.text: @riajunnelle 2/2 This means we are forced to cancel some bookings. We do our best to re-route you to other flights, but unfortunately the availability is currently limited. https://t.co/AGP1rRLHuF -Anu / Finnair
@riajunnelle Hi! Flights to Seoul start on 12.03 three times a week. It is important to know that on Tokyo and Seoul flights we have less seats than normally for customers due to loading reasons. 1/2
@oztiks 2/2 If there is still long time for the flights then could you send us a DM with booking details and phone number and email address so let´s see if we could help you from here -Anu / Finnair

@oztiks Hi! Unfortunately we have long queues in all of our contact channels and we want to prioritize the customer care via phone and chat at this moment. In urgent matter we advise to contact our customer care either via calling or chat. 1/2

@PeterPa87077572 2/2 Multiple new customer care agents have been recruited but training takes about 4 weeks so their help does not right away in customer care. Could you send us a DM with booking details and phone number and email address so let´s see if we could help you from here -Anu / Finnair

@PeterPa87077572 Hello Peter! Sorry to hear that our customer care have hard to reach. Unfortunately we have long queues in all of our contact channels and we want to prioritize the customer care via phone and chat at this moment. 1/2

@dovves1 @dovves We continue flying from Helsinki to Seoul three times a week as of 12 March. The flight time is 12-14 hours. Flights to Seoul operate on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays. Flights from Seoul to Helsinki operate on Thursdays, Sundays and Mondays.
Ilkka/Finnair

Confirm coronavirus related documents before your journey to selected destinations with our pre-check my certificates tool when checking in in advance online or through the Finnair app. The new feature allows you to upload your documents for a pre-check. https://t.co/mUFDqnGGPX https://t.co/uaikJYNF9n
@kozakana2 Hi @kozakana2. We have replied to your PM message. -Ilkka/Finnair
@KCat0102 Happy to hear that! Hopefully you'll travel with us shortly again :) /Elli
@joeyroberts69 Hi, if you still need help with this, please DM us your booking reference, travel dates and e-mail address on the booking and we can have a look. /Elli
@vitaminsludge If you still need assistance with this, please DM us your booking reference, travel dates, name and e-mail address on the booking and we can have a look. /Elli
@4evaInTreatment Hi, we are not flying in Russian airspace. All our flights to and from Japan are routed through either the northern or southern route avoiding Russian airspace. Heidi / Finnair

Finnair supports Ukrainians with a 95% discount on net fares for one-way tickets from Warsaw, Krakow, Gdansk, Budapest and Prague to Helsinki. The discount is available with code Ukraine95 at https://t.co/WWKAxOEyod through March. Taxes and fees will be added to ticket prices. https://t.co/iwpCw1a4rE

data.text: @MrLKSswe 2/2 Also we need to apply for permits to fly a new route, and some areas require special preparation, for example if there is a big difference in altitude. https://t.co/YddNo92MX9 -Anu / Finnair

@MrLKSswe Hi! Planning a detour to circumvent Russian airspace requires a lot of computation, so it is not a easy task any means. A longer route increases fuel consumption and requires changes working hours of flight crew. 1/ 2
@wilolsen 2/2 We also need to seek the required permits to fly the new route, and there may be areas that require special preparation such as high terrain or the polar region. -Anu / Finnair

@wilolsen Hi Willy! There are a lot of calculations to be done when planning the detour around Russian airspace. The longer route means more fuel burn, changes to the number of crew and their working hours, and all of this impacts the costs. 1/2

@SteepishR6 Hello Jyrki! Due to the closure of Russian airspace, we have made changes to our flights to Asian destinations and Russia. We have cancelled all flights to Russia until 28 May 2022. https://t.co/QrT3T0smIw -Ami

@whereisemil Hey! At this moment the situation truly affects our Asian flights. Some of the flights have been cancelled destination in Russia, Osaka and Hongkong for example but some flight routes have been changed in which the flight time has been extended. -Anu / Finnair

@cistavoda Hey Tuomas! At this moment the flights to Russia and back are cancelled until 28.05.2022. Passenger safety is our first priority. More info can be found https://t.co/zyMBDss4zW -Anu / Finnair

With Russian airspace closed, Finnair’s traffic planning and operations teams have worked hard to replan our Asian flights. When planning the detour around Russia, winds or jet streams play a key role. https://t.co/bIS2f2VG2V

data.text: @Chodaska Hello Monika! Unfortunately we have long queues on our all customer care channels at this moment and in urgent cases advise to contact via chat or phone. Hopefully you were able to get a hold of us in time. -Anu
@matti_arvela 2/2 Tarkemmin on konfilikti tilanteesta ja sen vaikutuksesta mainittu meidän nettisivuilla matkustustiedotteissa. -Anu

@matti_arvela Hei! Uusien lentoreittien suunnittelussa pitää ottaa huomioon monia asioita. Nyt esimerkiksi Bangkokin lennoissa olemme joutuneet ottamaan tilalle yölennon, koska kentillä on tietyt aika ikkunat lentoyhtiöille, milloin saa laskeutua. 1/2

We continue to serve Seoul and Shanghai from Helsinki but cancel flights to Osaka and Hong Kong until the end of April due to the closure of Russian airspace. If there are changes to your flight, we will contact you via email or text. https://t.co/jkhcVpRBqB https://t.co/qsZfhjRIgr
@kelrocky Please inform your case number as a DM. -Sara

@serivore1 Bonjour,

Merci de nous contacter par telephone ou chat pour pouvoir vous aider.

Amicalement,
Silvana
@DeanThomasM @FinnairHelps That also depends on the winds -  you will get a message from our customer service a day before the flight.

@AsadaNinopo Hi, we are still working on the solution for the Shanghai flight, and we will communicate to customers as soon as plans are in place. I am sorry about the continued uncertainty, but there are lot of details to be sorted. Br, Päivi/Finnair

@malihaider91 When your flight has been cancelled you should get a message from our customer service, including info on options that are available for you. Please do not share your reservation information in public.

@DeanThomasM @FinnairHelps Hi, we are flying to Singapore avoiding the Russian airspace -- we do not fly over Russia, Belarus or Ukraine. The flight time to Singapore will be longer than normal for this reason.

@serivore1 You should get a message directly from our customer service, including what the options are for you. You can also contact our customer service via phone or chat, see https://t.co/FQWNLgzvoG

We have cancelled our Seoul flights AY41/42 on 9/10 March and 11/12 March. We continue to seek solutions for operating our Asian routes avoiding the Russian airspace, and will communicate more once further plans are defined. For more, please see: https://t.co/aKtwZu200h https://t.co/EohhsoZJfw

urls.title: Changes in Finnair flights to Asia and Russia
urls.description: Due to the closure of Russian airspace, Finnair is making changes to its flights to Asian destinations and Russia. Due to the closure of Russian airspace, we are making changes to our flights to Asian destinations and Russia. We are using a longer route to Tokyo, Shanghai, Soul, Bangkok, Delhi and Singapore to avoid Russian airspace. We have cancelled all flights to Russia for the time being. In addition, flights to Hongkong are cancelled until 30 June 2022 and Osaka flights until 29 October 2022. Safety

data.text: @PatcohenNYT Hi Patricia! I sended you a DM a little while ago. Unfortunately we have long queues at this moment in all of our contact channels. -Anu / Finnair

@Jupupa1 Hei! Matkustajiemme turvallisuus on ensisijaisen tärkeää joten osa Venäjän ilmatilan kautta lennetyistä lennoista on hetkellisesti peruttu tai uudelleen reititetty. Tarkempaa tietoa löytyy meidän matkustustiedotteista. -Anu / Finnair

@thshegoesagain Hello Samantha. There is a certain weight limit in carry on bags and if it goes over then airport will charge the extra price. The baggage weight limits can be found from our website also. https://t.co/sfUBrw3RaP -Anu

data.text: @kelrocky Please inform your feedback case number as a DM, so that I can check the status of your claim. -Sara

@ReneSeta Hei! Olemme tehneet muutoksia lentoihimme Aasiaan, jotka aiemmin lensivät Venäjän ilmatilan kautta. Näistä muutoksista löytyy enemmän meidän matkustustiedotteissa, mutta osa lennoista on peruttu hetkellisesti ja osaan lennoista on tehty lentoreitin muutoksia. -Anu / Finnair

@MuoriskaJ Hei Mouriska! Aasiaan päin lentäviin lentoihin on jo tehty muutoksia. Osa lennoista on peruttu 06.03 ja  28.05 saakka ja osaan olemme tehneen lentoreitin muutoksia, jotka näkyvät lentoajan pidentymisenä. https://t.co/Xqej6iwolq -Anu

urls.title: Muutoksia Finnairin Aasian ja Venäjän lennoissa
urls.description: Venäjän ilmatilan sulkemisen vuoksi Finnair tekee muutoksia Aasian- ja Venäjän-lentoihinsa. Venäjän ilmatilan sulkemisen vuoksi teemme muutoksia Aasian- ja Venäjän-lentoihimme. Lennot Tokioon, Shanghaihin, Souliin, Bangkokiin, Delhiin ja Singaporeen lennetään kiertäen Venäjän ilmatila. Olemme peruneet kaikki Venäjän-lentomme toistaiseksi. Lisäksi olemme peruneet Hongkongin-lentomme 30.6.2022 asti sekä Osakan lentomme 29.10.2022 asti. Turvallisuus on aina tärkein prioriteettimme. Seuraamme tilannetta

data.text: @nz_penny Hi Penny! The problems in Manage booking are under the investigation as we speak, unfortunately we don´t have timeline known about the fix. In meantime advise is to contact our customer care which shows as long queues on our customer service also, apologies for inconvenience.

@PanuOksala Hi Panu! Sorry to hear about this. That is true, there was a fire alarm at the office, which later on turned out there was no fire, so no worries on that. Hopefully your friend got the issue resolved at a later time. 😊 Niki / Finnair

@withoutyour I am sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with the compensation decision you received. Unfortunately we cannot comment on claim issues here on social media, so if there is anything you want to discuss about, please contact your case handled via the feedback case. -Sara

data.text: @kelrocky Our CR team is facing a backlog at the moment so the response time of feedbacks and claims is several weeks. I am sorry for this. Thank you for your patience. -Sara

We will resume our flights to Tokyo Narita as of 9 March with four weekly frequencies avoiding the Russian airspace. The flight times will be approximately 13 hours and the flights connect smoothly to our European network via Helsinki Airport. Read more: https://t.co/rmuhSXVbpG https://t.co/Voymza2AyN

We want to support the children of Ukraine and are donating to @unicef_finland. You too can help and support. Through us, you can donate Finnair Plus points to many different charities. Read more and donate: https://t.co/1CAVS8cCoS https://t.co/bGAvGOBlQ2

@ArveSystad Hi. Unfortunately there's no multi-city option available online for now. Such bookings can be made with our customer service through phone or chat on our website, though. /Elli

The new Iittala Kuulas tableware is created for Finnair by one of Finland’s foremost living designers, Harri Koskinen. Koskinen knows all about the beauty, form and functionality needed to create the very best in Nordic design. Read more: https://t.co/8euebZcljb

urls.title: Harri Koskinen: The Finnish designer on bringing his Iittala vision to Finnair
urls.description: As Finland’s foremost living designer, Harri Koskinen knows all about the beauty, form and functionality needed to create the very best in Nordic design. His Block lamp has been part of MoMA’s permanent collection since 2000, while his Muu chair won him the prestigious Compasso d’Oro Award in 2004. Koskinen has also worked with iconic Finnish table and glassware brand Iittala throughout his career, from a scholarship in their glass factory after university in 1996, through to a period as its design

Curious about our new travel class, Premium Economy? Step inside: https://t.co/huehppBrZK
The sales will start on 1 March.

urls.title: Photo tour: Step inside Finnair’s new Premium Economy cabin
urls.description: Sitting comfortably in a cabin of its own between Business and Economy Class, our new Premium Economy cabin has cutting edge Nordic design at its heart. In Premium Economy, the seats offer 40% more space than in Economy Class, affording extra room to relax and enjoy the best that Finnair has to offer on a long haul trip to Asia or the United States. With a comfortable seat recline, a leg rest that supports the entire leg and memory foam cushions to ensure maximum comfort, it’s the perfect way to travel

data.text: @varya_en Hi! Sorry to hear that our Valentine campaign was not satisfactory. On our campaigns have certain rules when and how the campaign code can be used. -Anu

users.name: Forever inTREATMENT® | Visit Our New Site
